pullRequest.body:
Main defintions:

- `IsPurelyInseparable`: typeclass for purely inseparable field extension: an algebraic extension
  `E / F` is purely inseparable if and only if the minimal polynomial of every element of `E âˆ– F`
  is not separable.

Main results (not exhaustive):

- `isPurelyInseparable_iff_mem_pow`: a field extension `E / F` of exponential characteristic `q` is
  purely inseparable if and only if for every element `x` of `E`, there exists a natural number `n`
  such that `x ^ (q ^ n)` is contained in `F`.

- `IsPurelyInseparable.trans`: if `E / F` and `K / E` are both purely inseparable extensions, then
  `K / F` is also purely inseparable.

- `isPurelyInseparable_iff_natSepDegree_eq_one`: `E / F` is purely inseparable if and only if for
  every element `x` of `E`, its minimal polynomial has separable degree one.

- `isPurelyInseparable_iff_minpoly_eq_X_pow_sub_C`: a field extension `E / F` of exponential
  characteristic `q` is purely inseparable if and only if for every element `x` of `E`, the minimal
  polynomial of `x` over `F` is of form `X ^ (q ^ n) - y` for some natural number `n` and some
  element `y` of `F`.

- `isPurelyInseparable_iff_minpoly_eq_X_sub_C_pow`: a field extension `E / F` of exponential
  characteristic `q` is purely inseparable if and only if for every element `x` of `E`, the minimal
  polynomial of `x` over `F` is of form `(X - x) ^ (q ^ n)` for some natural number `n`.

- `isPurelyInseparable_iff_finSepDegree_eq_one`: an algebraic extension is purely inseparable
  if and only if it has (finite) separable degree one.

  **TODO:** remove the algebraic assumption. (will be in later PR)

- `IsPurelyInseparable.normal`: a purely inseparable extension is normal.

- `separableClosure.isPurelyInseparable`: if `E / F` is algebraic, then `E` is purely inseparable
  over the (relative) separable closure of `E / F`.

- `IsPurelyInseparable.injective_comp_algebraMap`: if `E / F` is purely inseparable, then for any
  reduced ring `L`, the map `(E â†’+* L) â†’ (F â†’+* L)` induced by `algebraMap F E` is injective.
  In other words, a purely inseparable field extension is an epimorphism in the category of fields.

- `isPurelyInseparable_adjoin_iff_mem_pow`: if `F` is of exponential characteristic `q`, then
  `F(S) / F` is a purely inseparable extension if and only if for any `x âˆˆ S`, `x ^ (q ^ n)` is
  contained in `F` for some `n : â„•`.

- `Field.finSepDegree_eq`: if `E / F` is algebraic, then the `Field.finSepDegree F E` is equal to
  `Field.sepDegree F E` as a natural number. This means that the cardinality of `Field.Emb F E`
  and the degree of `(separableClosure F E) / F` are both finite or infinite, and when they are
  finite, they coincide.

TODO: (will be in later PR)

- `IsPurelyInseparable.of_injective_comp_algebraMap`: if `L` is an algebraically closed field
  containing `E`, such that the map `(E â†’+* L) â†’ (F â†’+* L)` induced by `algebraMap F E` is
  injective, then `E / F` is purely inseparable. In other words, epimorphisms in the category of
  fields must be purely inseparable extensions. Need to use the fact that `Emb F E` is infintie
  when `E / F` is (purely) transcendental.

- Prove that the (infinite) inseparable degree are multiplicative; linearly disjoint argument is needed.

---

> I think the reviewing process will be faster if you can split everything except the new file into a new PR.

OK, will do it later.

> Prove that the (infinite) separable degree multiply by the (infinite) inseparable degree is equal
to the (infinite) field extension degree. Need to use the linearly disjoint argument.

I don't understand this TODO. This is already in mathlib as [Field.sepDegree_mul_insepDegree](https://leanprover-community.github.io/mathlib4_docs/Mathlib/FieldTheory/SeparableClosure.html#Field.sepDegree_mul_insepDegree) and the proof is just `rank_mul_rank`. I think you meant to say multiplicativity. As discussed on Zulip, the multiplicativity of sepDegree can readily be done but that of insepDegree will need linear disjointness.

> > Prove that the (infinite) separable degree multiply by the (infinite) inseparable degree is equal
> > to the (infinite) field extension degree. Need to use the linearly disjoint argument.
> 
> I don't understand this TODO. This is already in mathlib as [Field.sepDegree_mul_insepDegree](https://leanprover-community.github.io/mathlib4_docs/Mathlib/FieldTheory/SeparableClosure.html#Field.sepDegree_mul_insepDegree) and the proof is just `rank_mul_rank`. I think you meant to say multiplicativity.

Sorry, you're right.

> As discussed on Zulip, the multiplicativity of sepDegree can readily be done but that of insepDegree will need linear disjointness.

Oh, let me check it later. I'm not sure I will write down the proof in time for this PR; I'll try.
This PR is pretty big. Is it possible to split it?

I think it's possible but maybe not that easy; let's discuss it then. I think basically 1/3 of it is the proof of the tower law of the (infinite) separable degree.

Went through about one half of the PR:
maybe use `proof_wanted`?

But it complains about all variables being unused. Will it trigger "warning-as-error" error?

[EDIT] Yes, it errors. Maybe they should fix the `proof_wanted` logic to make all variables used.
It turns out that this result cannot be proved inside this file. ðŸ˜… Separable degree argument is required.

Why? I think combining [IsAlgClosed.of_exists_root](https://leanprover-community.github.io/mathlib4_docs/Mathlib/FieldTheory/IsAlgClosed/Basic.html#IsAlgClosed.of_exists_root) with the definition [PerfectField](https://leanprover-community.github.io/mathlib4_docs/Mathlib/FieldTheory/Perfect.html#PerfectField) gives a proof.

> Why? I think combining [IsAlgClosed.of_exists_root](https://leanprover-community.github.io/mathlib4_docs/Mathlib/FieldTheory/IsAlgClosed/Basic.html#IsAlgClosed.of_exists_root) with the definition [PerfectField](https://leanprover-community.github.io/mathlib4_docs/Mathlib/FieldTheory/Perfect.html#PerfectField) gives a proof.

No, these two results in their current form can't solve this problem. Two ways to fix it:
- Prove that if `K / k` is algebraic, `k` is perfect, then `K` is also perfect. This seems to require separable degree argument.
- Prove a modified version of `IsAlgClosed.of_exists_root` which states that if `K / k` is algebraic, any monic irreducible polynomial over `k` ~~has a root~~ splits in `K`, then `K` is algebraically closed (in fact an algebraic closure of `k`).

I think both of them are important results, but not in mathlib yet.

Oh I see, I think I read `PerfectField k` as `PerfectField K`. For your first option, you just need to know that every irreducible polynomial in K[X] divides some irreducible polynomial in k[X]. You can do this by adjoining a root of the first polynomial to K and take its minpoly over k (we know it's integral over k by [isIntegral_trans](https://leanprover-community.github.io/mathlib4_docs/Mathlib/RingTheory/IntegralClosure.html#isIntegral_trans)).

The stronger version of your second option is also true, see Theorem 2 in https://kconrad.math.uconn.edu/blurbs/galoistheory/algclosure.pdf, but it takes one page and a half to prove; would be nice to have it in mathlib!

> Oh I see, I think I read `PerfectField k` as `PerfectField K`. For your first option, you just need to know that every irreducible polynomial in K[X] divides some irreducible polynomial in k[X]. You can do this by adjoining a root of the first polynomial to K and take its minpoly over k (we know it's integral over k by [isIntegral_trans](https://leanprover-community.github.io/mathlib4_docs/Mathlib/RingTheory/IntegralClosure.html#isIntegral_trans)).

Thank you very much, it works!

Let me add a TODO to `IsAlgClosed`. I think there should also be a `IsSepClosed` version?

#9378 should have fixed the capitalization issue, but I agree the manual lemma is better here.
I think you can use `(frobenius_inj R p).iterate n`?
Why is this private? I see no harm in it being public.
Same for the other private lemmas below.
Because it is a special case of `isPurelyInseparable_adjoin_iff_mem_pow.2`. Same as the following private lemmas.
You can still keep it public and/or add a pointer to `isPurelyInseparable_adjoin_iff_mem_pow` in the docstring.

This instance could have a [PerfectField **K**] version too.
~~We should provide `[PerfectField K] [IsSepClosed K] : IsAlgClosed K` too. That need not mention `k` but once combined with `Algebra.IsAlgebraic.perfectField` gives this immediately.~~

I already added this, it's called `isAlgClosed_of_perfectField` at https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/pull/9488/files#diff-65948e34f88316c627865217c5250797373887972cda16a040e4b044067aac93R99
I think we have the same result with PerfectField replaced by IsSepClosed ...

Not yet, at least loogle can't find it. We only have the result that separably closed field doesn't have non-trivial separable extension.

[EDIT] The result you mentioned seems have no simple proof (i.e. requires separable degree argument), though.

Yeah, sorry for bad wording, I meant it should be true, not that we have it in mathlib. I think the following proof won't be too difficult: assume `IsSepClosed K`, we have `IsPurelyInseparable K (AlgebraicClosure L)` by `isPurelyInseparable_of_isSepClosed` in this PR. By `IsPurelyInseparable.tower_top` we deduce `IsPurelyInseparable L (AlgebraicClosure L)`, which should be equivalent to `separableClosure L (AlgebraicClosure L) = âŠ¥`, but this is missing from this PR. (Note the dual statement that `perfectClosure L E = âŠ¥` implies `IsSeparable L E` is [not true](https://math.stackexchange.com/q/1275070/12932).) Finally we use [IsSepClosed.separableClosure_eq_bot_iff](https://leanprover-community.github.io/mathlib4_docs/Mathlib/FieldTheory/SeparableClosure.html#IsSepClosed.separableClosure_eq_bot_iff) to conclude `IsSepClosed L`.
(We could combine the last steps to a lemma that says `IsSepClosed K` iff `IsPurelyInseparable K (AlgebraicClosure K)`, and dually, `PerfectField K` iff `IsSeparable K (AlgebraicClosure K)`.)

I have another proof in mind, which uses multiplicativity of (finite) separable degree.

Let me look at your suggestions later.
Actually, I think (Edit: the second part of) your definition of `IsPurelyInseparable L E` is defeq to `separableClosure L E â‰¤ âŠ¥` ...

> ... `IsPurelyInseparable L (AlgebraicClosure L)`, which should be equivalent to `separableClosure L (AlgebraicClosure L) = âŠ¥`, but this is missing from this PR.

It is `separableClosure.eq_bot_iff` at line 182.

[EDIT] And I have just added the proof of `Algebra.IsAlgebraic.isSepClosed`.

> We could combine the last steps to a lemma that says `IsSepClosed K` iff `IsPurelyInseparable K (AlgebraicClosure K)`,

I'll add `isSepClosed_iff_isPurelyInseparable_algebraicClosure` later.

> and dually, `PerfectField K` iff `IsSeparable K (AlgebraicClosure K)`.)

For this it seems that I need to use the fact that if `E / F` is separable, `E` is perfect, then `F` is also perfect, which is not in mathlib yet.

As for the proof of this fact, I came up with a proof which uses the equivalent definition that Frobenius is surjective: for any `x : F` there exists `y : E` such that `y ^ p` is in `F`, which means that `F(y) / F` is both purely inseparable and separable, hence `y` is in `F`.

Any suggestions for a simpler proof?

[EDIT] By the way, more theory on the perfect fields is developed in <https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/blob/acmepjz_sep_degree_2/Mathlib/FieldTheory/RelPerfectClosure.lean>. So after `perfectField_iff_isSeparable_algebraicClosure` I think I'll stop adding more result on perfect fields into this PR.

  let i : S â†’+* L := Subsemiring.inclusion fun x hx â†¦ subset_adjoin E (S : Set K) hx
```

Yes, it's `isPurelyInseparable_iff_mem_pow`.
I think some lemmas below should have implicit variables, for example `eq_bot_of_isPurelyInseparable_of_isSeparable` or `isPurelyInseparable_iff_natSepDegree_eq_one `

- Prove that if `K / k` is algebraic, any monic irreducible polynomial over `k` splits in `K`, then
```
I think we should have the forward direction as its own lemma with `IsPurelyInseparable` as a typeclass variable
Add as `IsPurelyInseparable.mem_pow`.

Why is the name not `pow_mem` but `mem_pow`?

Also, I feel that it would make things easier if you first define the relative perfect closure in the following way:
```
def perfectClosure : IntermediateField F E :=
  let âŸ¨q, _instâŸ© := Classical.indefiniteDescription _ (ExpChar.exists F)
  { carrier := {x : E | âˆƒ n : â„•, x ^ q ^ n âˆˆ (algebraMap F E).range}
    zero_mem' := âŸ¨0, by rw [pow_zero, pow_one]; exact zero_mem _âŸ©
    one_mem' := âŸ¨0, by rw [pow_zero, pow_one]; exact one_mem _âŸ©
    add_mem' := by
      rintro x y âŸ¨n, hxâŸ© âŸ¨m, hyâŸ©
      use n + m
      have := expChar_of_injective_algebraMap (algebraMap F E).injective q
      rw [add_pow_expChar_pow, pow_add, pow_mul, mul_comm (q ^ n), pow_mul]
      exact add_mem (pow_mem hx _) (pow_mem hy _)
    mul_mem' := by
      rintro x y âŸ¨n, hxâŸ© âŸ¨m, hyâŸ©
      use n + m
      rw [mul_pow, pow_add, pow_mul, mul_comm (q ^ n), pow_mul]
      exact mul_mem (pow_mem hx _) (pow_mem hy _)
    inv_mem' := by
      rintro x âŸ¨n, hxâŸ©
      use n; rw [inv_pow]
      apply inv_mem (id hx : _ âˆˆ (âŠ¥ : IntermediateField F E))
    algebraMap_mem' := fun x â†¦ âŸ¨0, by rw [pow_zero, pow_one]; exact âŸ¨x, rflâŸ©âŸ© }
```
and rephrase this lemma as `IsPurelyInseparable F E â†” perfectClosure F E = âŠ¤`. For an intermediate field `L`, you can deduce that `IsPurelyInseparable F L â†” L â‰¤ perfectClosure F E`. This should make many theorems trivial (starting from `isPurelyInseparable_adjoin_finset_of_mem_pow`), and you could follow similar arguments for the "dual" (separable) case once you know `separableClosure` is a field.

> Why is the name not `pow_mem` but `mem_pow`?

Sorry, will rename it soon.
 
> Also, I feel that it would make things easier if you first define the relative perfect closure in the following way:
> 
> ```lean
> def perfectClosure : IntermediateField F E :=
>   let âŸ¨q, _instâŸ© := Classical.indefiniteDescription _ (ExpChar.exists F)
>   { carrier := {x : E | âˆƒ n : â„•, x ^ q ^ n âˆˆ (algebraMap F E).range}
>     zero_mem' := âŸ¨0, by rw [pow_zero, pow_one]; exact zero_mem _âŸ©
>     one_mem' := âŸ¨0, by rw [pow_zero, pow_one]; exact one_mem _âŸ©
>     add_mem' := by
>       rintro x y âŸ¨n, hxâŸ© âŸ¨m, hyâŸ©
>       use n + m
>       have := expChar_of_injective_algebraMap (algebraMap F E).injective q
>       rw [add_pow_expChar_pow, pow_add, pow_mul, mul_comm (q ^ n), pow_mul]
>       exact add_mem (pow_mem hx _) (pow_mem hy _)
>     mul_mem' := by
>       rintro x y âŸ¨n, hxâŸ© âŸ¨m, hyâŸ©
>       use n + m
>       rw [mul_pow, pow_add, pow_mul, mul_comm (q ^ n), pow_mul]
>       exact mul_mem (pow_mem hx _) (pow_mem hy _)
>     inv_mem' := by
>       rintro x âŸ¨n, hxâŸ©
>       use n; rw [inv_pow]
>       apply inv_mem (id hx : _ âˆˆ (âŠ¥ : IntermediateField F E))
>     algebraMap_mem' := fun x â†¦ âŸ¨0, by rw [pow_zero, pow_one]; exact âŸ¨x, rflâŸ©âŸ© }
> ```
> 
> and rephrase this lemma as `IsPurelyInseparable F E â†” perfectClosure F E = âŠ¤`. For an intermediate field `L`, you can deduce that `IsPurelyInseparable F L â†” L â‰¤ perfectClosure F E`. This should make many theorems trivial (starting from `isPurelyInseparable_adjoin_finset_of_mem_pow`), and you could follow similar arguments for the "dual" (separable) case once you know `separableClosure` is a field.

Currently the `perfectClosure` is defined in a downsteram file. Let me study later to see that if it can be moved into this file.

Your definition of perfectClosure (as the iSup of purely inseparable subextensions) requires IsPurelyInseparable, while mine doesn't. I originally thought yours is necessary because mine depends on the characteristic, until I realized yesterday that we can just choose an expChar, so we don't need to carry (q) [expChar F q] around ... we need to prove expChar is unique though.

> Your definition of perfectClosure (as the iSup of purely inseparable subextensions) requires IsPurelyInseparable, while mine doesn't.

Yes. These two are equivalent definitions I think.

> I originally thought yours is necessary because mine depends on the characteristic, until I realized yesterday that we can just choose an expChar, so we don't need to carry (q) [expChar F q] around ...

Another idea is to use `ringExpChar R := if ringChar R = 0 then 1 else ringChar R` instead of the `q` in the definition of relative perfect closure, and in the proof of `add_mem'`, etc., we can show that if `ExpChar F q` then `q` is equal to `ringExpChar R` (similar to [ringChar.eq](https://leanprover-community.github.io/mathlib4_docs/Mathlib/Algebra/CharP/Basic.html#ringChar.eq) and [ringChar.charP](https://leanprover-community.github.io/mathlib4_docs/Mathlib/Algebra/CharP/Basic.html#ringChar.charP)).

> we need to prove expChar is unique though.

For `CharP` there is [CharP.exists_unique](https://leanprover-community.github.io/mathlib4_docs/Mathlib/Algebra/CharP/Basic.html#CharP.exists_unique). I didn't realize the importance of it, so I haven't added the corresponding version for `ExpChar`.
or just use `max (ringChar R) 1` ... but it seems we'd need to build APIs around ringChar, I think there's no lemmas like `(a+b)^ringChar = a^ringChar + b^ringChar` yet.
`ringChar.charP` is an instance which states `CharP R (ringChar R)` so I assume that `(a+b)^ringChar = a^ringChar + b^ringChar` can be rewritten automatically as usual.
That's good to know! I guess we could add ringExpChar as an abbrev and make ExpChar R (ringExpChar R) an instance as well.

The lemma is more general because it applies to reduced rings. (Same for the module docstring)
```suggestion
/-- If `E / F` is purely inseparable, then for any reduced ring `L`, the map `(E â†’+* L) â†’ (F â†’+* L)`
induced by `algebraMap F E` is injective. In particular, a purely inseparable field extension
is an epimorphism in the category of fields. -/
```
Are we missing a lemma that directly give us `CharZero k âˆ¨ âˆƒ p : â„•, Fact p.Prime âˆ§ CharP k p`?
I think there is a `charZero_or_charP` but I can't find it. Maybe there is no such result yet.
Oh, it's [CharP.char_is_prime_or_zero](https://leanprover-community.github.io/mathlib4_docs/Mathlib/Algebra/CharP/Basic.html#CharP.char_is_prime_or_zero).

It still doesn't give you a Fact instance directly, and you need to combine it with `CharP.exists`. I think it's worthwhile to add the lemma `CharZero k âˆ¨ âˆƒ p : â„•, Fact p.Prime âˆ§ CharP k p` because you get all the instances in place in one stretch with `obtain h | âŸ¨p, _, _âŸ© :=`.
Added `CharP.exists'` in #9573.

![1704703968805](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/assets/3064145/4a49fc71-aebd-4138-af55-d2346944f73b)

p.227 of Lang's Algebra introduces the notion of a distinguished class of extensions, of which the classes of algebraic, separable, and purely inseparable extensions are all examples. Condition (1) is basically `trans` and `tower_top/bot` lemmas, and Condition (3) is `sup` lemmas (follows from (1) and (2)). Condition (2) says if K and L are intermediate fields of E/F and if K/F is in the class, then KL/L is also in the class. In Lean this can be generalized to say that if E/L/F is a tower and K is an intermediate field of E/F such that K/F is in the class, then `adjoin L K` over `L` is in the class. This type of lemmas seem to be missing from mathlib at this moment and it looks like they may be useful in places like this.
Looks good. In algebraic geometry there are also such distinguished classes I think (e.g. separated, proper). Do mathlib have such APIs? We can mimic them.
We have something similar. See for example `AlgebraicGeometry/Morphisms/Basic.lean` or `CategoryTheory/MorphismProperty.lean`

```suggestion
  In particular, a purely inseparable field extension is an epimorphism in the category of fields.
```

```suggestion
- `IsPurelyInseparable.of_injective_comp_algebraMap`: if `L` is an algebraically closed field
  containing `E`, such that the map `(E â†’+* L) â†’ (F â†’+* L)` induced by `algebraMap F E` is
  injective, then `E / F` is purely inseparable. In other words, epimorphisms in the category of
  fields must be purely inseparable extensions. Need to use the fact that `Emb F E` is infinite
  (or just not a singleton) when `E / F` is (purely) transcendental.
```

```suggestion
- Restate some intermediate result in terms of linearly disjointness.
```
Can you also add the backward direction without the IsAlgebraic condition?
Added `eq_separableClosure`.

```suggestion
  âŸ¨fun h â†¦ isPurelyInseparable_iff.2 fun x â†¦ âŸ¨(halg x).isIntegral, fun hs â†¦ by
    simpa only [h] using mem_separableClosure_iff.2 hsâŸ©, fun _ â†¦ eq_bot_of_isPurelyInseparable F EâŸ©
```

These two are actually automatic (but beware of the bug https://github.com/leanprover/lean4/issues/3150)

Thanks. Let me see if it compiles. Perhaps the same lines can also be removed in the definition of `separableClosure`?
That's a good idea too!

  Probably an argument using linearly disjointness is needed.
```

    (perfectClosure F E).map i â‰¤ perfectClosure F K :=
  map_le_iff_le_comap.mpr (perfectClosure.eq_comap_of_algHom i).le
```

```suggestion
    perfectClosure F K = (perfectClosure F E).map i.toAlgHom :=
  le_antisymm (fun x hx â†¦ âŸ¨i.symm x,
    (map_mem_perfectClosure_iff i.symm.toAlgHom).2 hx, i.right_inv xâŸ©) (map_le_of_algHom i.toAlgHom)
```
fits in one line

  exact âŸ¨y, (algebraMap E K).injective (h.symm â–¸ (IsScalarTower.algebraMap_apply F E K y).symm)âŸ©
```

`â€¹_â€º` is interchangeable with `by assumption`, I believe. If you like it please replace everywhere.

  (isPurelyInseparable_iff_pow_mem F q).1 â€¹_â€º x
```
Thanks. I just can't remember how to type `â€¹` ðŸ˜‚
It's `\f<`. Not as hard as âŸ®, right? ðŸ˜„

golf using `injective_comp_algebraMap` below:
```suggestion
instance [IsPurelyInseparable F E] (L : Type w) [CommRing L] [IsReduced L] [Algebra F L] :
    Subsingleton (E â†’â‚[F] L) where
  allEq f g := AlgHom.coe_ringHom_injective <|
    IsPurelyInseparable.injective_comp_algebraMap F E L (by simp_rw [AlgHom.comp_algebraMap])

instance [IsPurelyInseparable F E] : Subsingleton (Emb F E) := by rw [Emb]; infer_instance

/-- A purely inseparable extension has (finite) separable degree one. -/
theorem IsPurelyInseparable.finSepDegree_eq_one [IsPurelyInseparable F E] :
    finSepDegree F E = 1 := by
  rw [finSepDegree, Nat.card_eq_one_iff_unique]; constructor <;> infer_instance
```

I realize that we should upgrade [Field.instNonemptyEmb](https://leanprover-community.github.io/mathlib4_docs/Mathlib/FieldTheory/SeparableDegree.html#Field.instNonemptyEmb) to `Inhabited` and then this instance could be `Unique (Emb F E)` and we could use [Nat.card_unique](https://leanprover-community.github.io/mathlib4_docs/Mathlib/SetTheory/Cardinal/Finite.html#Nat.card_unique) in the next proof.
Changed to `Field.instInhabitedEmb`. But in fact it is not used.

And `(fun x â†¦ x ^ q ^ n) âˆ˜ v` can be replaced by `(v Â· ^ q ^ n)`.

I've opened an easy PR #10017 and a refactor PR #10016 with the main purpose of golfing this proof.
The golfed proof is [here](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/commit/3f93a2df3021f115939d0c9394c3efa6d0c31183).

I have [more golfs](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/compare/e5eb62dff7bb69f587ba86add3fe9f59a7405cf7...purely_insep_merge) at that branch but other than that I think this is ready to go!
Would you also merge my branch?

Sure, thank you very much. Would you like to push your changes to this PR by yourself?
Done! Hopefully CI is happy ...

```suggestion
This file contains basics about purely inseparable extensions and the relative perfect closure
```

```suggestion
- `IsPurelyInseparable`: typeclass for purely inseparable field extensions: an algebraic extension
```

```suggestion
- `perfectClosure`: the relative perfect closure of `F` in `E`, it consists of the elements `x` of `E`
```

```suggestion
```

There is only one error (very easy to fix) without this line, so let's not open `Classical`.

```suggestion
/-- Typeclass for purely inseparable field extensions: an algebraic extension `E / F` is purely
```
What are we missing for this TODO?

I think we need some result that for a transcendental extension `E / F`, the `finSepDegree` cannot be one, namely, there are at least two `F`-embeddings from `E` to the algebraic closure of `E`. Maybe @alreadydone has some preliminary works on it.
Let's keep this for another PR, has this one is already pretty long.

Mainly we need a version of [IsTranscendenceBasis.isAlgebraic](https://leanprover-community.github.io/mathlib4_docs/Mathlib/RingTheory/AlgebraicIndependent.html#IsTranscendenceBasis.isAlgebraic) with IntermediateField.adjoin rather than Algebra.adjoin, and we need to construct different embeddings of these IntermediateField.adjoin (which are purely transcendental extensions, and for this purpose IsTranscendenceBasis can be relaxed to AlgebraicIndependent).
If we want to count the number of embeddings, [even more work need to be done](https://leanprover.zulipchat.com/#narrow/stream/217875-Is-there-code-for-X.3F/topic/Separability.20degree.3F/near/411585334).
All these would better be done in another PR touching RingTheory/AlgebraicIndependent.

@riccardobrasca I moved one new lemma and two golfs from [#9311](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/pull/9311/files#diff-06dd56536ac06af05c958087a090cbf331a3b2c3e753dd508dabd361e8d7b197) to this PR to streamline [this proof](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/pull/9488/commits/e0c5313ee966ce67ddc8ff2d9cd8e6f6fc82baa4#diff-1183eb4a8c4f60106973f5393ebfa817666cb122fe0a95ccdf55c94a4880b965L458-R464) below.

nodes.body:
> Prove that the (infinite) separable degree multiply by the (infinite) inseparable degree is equal
to the (infinite) field extension degree. Need to use the linearly disjoint argument.

I don't understand this TODO. This is already in mathlib as [Field.sepDegree_mul_insepDegree](https://leanprover-community.github.io/mathlib4_docs/Mathlib/FieldTheory/SeparableClosure.html#Field.sepDegree_mul_insepDegree) and the proof is just `rank_mul_rank`. I think you meant to say multiplicativity. As discussed on Zulip, the multiplicativity of sepDegree can readily be done but that of insepDegree will need linear disjointness.

> > Prove that the (infinite) separable degree multiply by the (infinite) inseparable degree is equal
> > to the (infinite) field extension degree. Need to use the linearly disjoint argument.
> 
> I don't understand this TODO. This is already in mathlib as [Field.sepDegree_mul_insepDegree](https://leanprover-community.github.io/mathlib4_docs/Mathlib/FieldTheory/SeparableClosure.html#Field.sepDegree_mul_insepDegree) and the proof is just `rank_mul_rank`. I think you meant to say multiplicativity.

Sorry, you're right.

> As discussed on Zulip, the multiplicativity of sepDegree can readily be done but that of insepDegree will need linear disjointness.

Oh, let me check it later. I'm not sure I will write down the proof in time for this PR; I'll try.

nodes.body: Went through about one half of the PR:
This PR is pretty big. Is it possible to split it?

> This PR is pretty big. Is it possible to split it?

I think it's possible but maybe not that easy; let's discuss it then. I think basically 1/3 of it is the proof of the tower law of the (infinite) separable degree.

```lean
/-- If `E` is a perfect field of characteristic `p`, then the (relative) perfect closure
`perfectClosure F E` is perfect. -/
instance perfectClosure.perfectRing (p : â„•) [ExpChar F p] [ExpChar E p]
    [PerfectRing E p] : PerfectRing (perfectClosure F E) p := .ofSurjective _ p fun x â†¦ by
```
but maybe let's leave it for next PR?
As you like!

Thanks!
